```go
package main

import (
	"github.com/pulumi/pulumi-aws/sdk/v6/go/aws/eks"
	"github.com/pulumi/pulumi/sdk/v3/go/pulumi"
)

func main() {
	pulumi.Run(func(ctx *pulumi.Context) error {
		_, err := eks.NewIdentityProviderConfig(ctx, "example", &eks.IdentityProviderConfigArgs{
			ClusterName: pulumi.Any(aws_eks_cluster.Example.Name),
			Oidc: &eks.IdentityProviderConfigOidcArgs{
				ClientId:                   pulumi.String("your client_id"),
				IdentityProviderConfigName: pulumi.String("example"),
				IssuerUrl:                  pulumi.String("your issuer_url"),
			},
		})
		if err != nil {
			return err
		}
		return nil
	})
}
```

    <dd><p>Key-value map of resource tags. If configured with a provider <code>default_tags</code> configuration block present, tags with matching keys will overwrite those defined at the provider-level.</p>
</dd></dl>
</pulumi-choosable>
</div>

## Supporting Types



<h4 id="identityproviderconfigoidc">Identity<wbr>Provider<wbr>Config<wbr>Oidc</h4>

<div>
<pulumi-choosable type="language" values="csharp">
<dl class="resources-properties"><dt class="property-required property-replacement"
            title="Required">
        <span id="clientid_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#clientid_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Client<wbr>Id</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Client ID for the OpenID Connect identity provider.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-required property-replacement"
            title="Required">
        <span id="identityproviderconfigname_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#identityproviderconfigname_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Identity<wbr>Provider<wbr>Config<wbr>Name</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>The name of the identity provider config.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-required property-replacement"
            title="Required">
        <span id="issuerurl_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#issuerurl_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Issuer<wbr>Url</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Issuer URL for the OpenID Connect identity provider.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional property-replacement"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="groupsclaim_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#groupsclaim_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Groups<wbr>Claim</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>The JWT claim that the provider will use to return groups.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional property-replacement"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="groupsprefix_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#groupsprefix_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Groups<wbr>Prefix</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>A prefix that is prepended to group claims e.g., <code>oidc:</code>.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional property-replacement"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="requiredclaims_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#requiredclaims_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Required<wbr>Claims</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">Dictionary&lt;string, string&gt;</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>The key value pairs that describe required claims in the identity token.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional property-replacement"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="usernameclaim_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#usernameclaim_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Username<wbr>Claim</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>The JWT claim that the provider will use as the username.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional property-replacement"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="usernameprefix_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#usernameprefix_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Username<wbr>Prefix</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>A prefix that is prepended to username claims.</p>
</dd></dl>
</pulumi-choosable>
</div>

<div>
<pulumi-choosable type="language" values="go">
<dl class="resources-properties"><dt class="property-required property-replacement"
            title="Required">
        <span id="clientid_go">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#clientid_go" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Client<wbr>Id</a>

        <span class="property-indicator"></span>

        <span id="identityproviderconfigname_go">

        <span class="property-indicator"></span>

## Import



Using `pulumi import`, import EKS Identity Provider Configurations using the `cluster_name` and `identity_provider_config_name` separated by a colon (`:`). For example:

```sh
 $ pulumi import aws:eks/identityProviderConfig:IdentityProviderConfig my_identity_provider_config my_cluster:my_identity_provider_config
```
